title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message: the board does just like the older mac board used to do. The fan slowly ramps to full speed and it's laggy.  Is there an smc bypass procedure for the newer models?

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message: Do you have known good battery connected?

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message: Start in diagnostic mode and check what errors pop up.

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message:
Test with known good trackpad board/flex.
Also try disconnecting camera flex from T-CON.

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message: diode mode to ground on i2c_tpad_3v3_scl is 1.466 and i2c_tpad_3v3_sda is 0.958  . i remember you telling me that  the readings on a data bus line should almost match.

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message:
Too big difference; check on the other side of Q6861 too.
Inspect R6877/8 and R6812/3.

Did you check in diode mode w/ and w/o trackpad connected?

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message: those reading are without the trackpad cable connected.  i2c_tpad_3v3_sda reads the same on a known working board. i2c_sense_scl seems to be culprit. I2c_sense_scl  is 1.992 and i2c_sense_sda is 0.471  in diode mode to ground

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message: do you know if u3900 has one or two layers of solder on this model?  i'll attempt to reball it if there is just one

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message: i've replaced that u3900 chip with another one. now the amp meter shows 20v 0.000a with a charged battery

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message:
You should use SoC ROM (U4770) from the same board of the "new" T2.
Also need DFU restore.

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message: when jumpering soc_force_dfu, can i solder the jumper before applying power or only after applying power?

title: 820-01598 thermal sensor issue
message:
You must solder wire before applying power.
Cut it off as soon as machine enters into DFU mode.
